actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law

official_title: To encourage innovation and productivity, stimulate trade, and promote the competitiveness and technological leadership of the United States.
short_title: Cooperative Productivity and Competitiveness Act of 1991

summary.text: Cooperative Productivity and Competitiveness Act of 1991 - Amends the National Cooperative Research Act of 1984 to authorize joint production ventures for purposes of improving technology in the production of U.S. goods or services and the competitiveness of U.S. industries. Requires the worldwide capacity of suppliers to provide a product, process, or service to be considered in determining a properly defined relevant market with respect to the rule of reason standard used in determining whether a joint research and development venture violates U.S. antitrust laws.

titles.title: Cooperative Productivity and Competitiveness Act of 1991
To encourage innovation and productivity, stimulate trade, and promote the competitiveness and technological leadership of the United States.
